TopicTitle: What do you like doing in between missions

Articles.Content:
I personally like to send rescue missions, do local contracts and do clean up procedures at the ksc. And maybe send another mun mission.

- - - Updated - - -

What I ask
Between? I do those thing you listed during missions. More fun than time-accelerating until an interplanetary expedition arrives, and make me feel really efficient.

My main goal is to reach the furthest celestial body, without science mining, anything else to me is the in between stuff. Whether that is rescues, part testing, simulated flights for fuel consumption checks or tourist flights.
In between contract missions, I design and test aircraft and vehicles. Sometimes I'll take one out for fun before going back and doing more contracts.
What is this in between you speak of? There is only the next mission, designing for other missions, and redesigning old ones.
Testing new vehicles and do routine resupply missions
Testing new ideas for upcoming missions and collecting science whilst doing it.
I like to do low level flights arround the mountain with my jets... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

The Time Warp!

"It's just a step to the left"... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

someone had to do it
Well lately I have been scuba diving.

Do contracts that involve rover driving. Read a book. Build crafts and try to get them into orbit. Do contrats. Listen to Music. Sleep. Make breakfast, lunch or dinner depending on the time of day. Go get snacks to eat. Make posts on forums. Chat on CIG website.

The same thing we do every night pinky; add moar boosters, and try to take over the world. 

That, and prototype and test attempts at a single stage to almost anywhere mk3 spaceplane, with mining and refining capability, without any real understanding of rocket science, aerodynamics or basic math. Great way to kill time.

And kerbals. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Is it some sort of Cantor-set mission?
I tend to not have any "between missions" time. Either I'm doing 6 other missions at the same time and jumping between them, or time warping (again).
